abstract: Google fears that Microsoft could leverage its dominance of the browser market to promote its search business.
snippet: Google fears that Microsoft could leverage its dominance of the browser market to promote its search business.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — Google’s new browser, Chrome, is named for something it mostly lacks.

headline.main: Search Giant Wants a Share of Browser Market
headline.print_headline:
Serious Potential in Google’s Browser: The Search Giant Wants a Share
Of a Market Dominated by Microsoft

abstract: Google’s minimalist Chrome browser is built for a future that blurs the lines of Web and desktop.
snippet: Google’s minimalist Chrome browser is built for a future that blurs the lines of Web and desktop.
lead_paragraph: Does the world really need another Web browser?

abstract: With Apple expected to unveil new versions of its iPod music player next week, what’s new with Microsoft’s Zune player? And do customers really care?
snippet: With Apple expected to unveil new versions of its iPod music player next week, what’s new with Microsoft’s Zune player? And do customers really care?
lead_paragraph: You’ve heard by now –- because Apple news seems to travel faster than the broadband lines it’s carried over -– that Steve Jobs & Co. are planning a Sept. 9 media event. While Apple has not disclosed the precise nature of said event, it would be hard for a sentient being not to conclude it is related to the iPod group of products. The event invitation is titled “Let’s Rock,” and it features a silhouetted image from the company’s iPod marketing campaign.

headline.main: Forget Apple — Let’s Speculate About the Microsoft Zune

abstract: Microsoft is cutting the price of its Xbox 360 game console. The base model will sell for $199, making it cheaper than the $249 Nintendo Wii.
snippet: Microsoft is cutting the price of its Xbox 360 game console. The base model will sell for $199, making it cheaper than the $249 Nintendo Wii.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said on Thursday that it was cutting the price of its Xbox 360 game console. Starting this Friday, its base model will now sell for $199, down from $279. That makes the 360 the cheapest of the new generation of consoles — and, pointedly, cheaper than the $249 Nintendo Wii.

headline.main: Xbox 360, Lagging in Sales, Will Cost Less

abstract: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives?
snippet: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives?
lead_paragraph: Creating a document in Microsoft Word and need to put in sample text to hold the space until the real copy arrives? You don’t have to cut and paste a thing  and you can tell Word exactly how much fake text to supply. Say you want to add four paragraphs of three sentences each. In your document, just type in “=rand(4,3)” on its own line, without the quotation marks, and press the Enter key. Word fills the space with text in the requested amount of paragraphs and sentences. The content varies with the version of Word. More details and instructions are at www.support.microsoft.com/kb/212251.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Faking Text in Word
